definition: to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad
a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]

sentences.english: The ability to find common ground with others is a cornerstone of likability.
sentences.chinese: 找到与他人的共同之处的能力是讨人喜欢的基础。

sentences.english: Bought red wine, after being washed down the pot.
sentences.chinese: 红酒故意讨人喜欢之后，倒正在洗净的锅里。

sentences.english: Mrs Whitehead added: 'He is a lovely little thing.
sentences.chinese: 怀特海德夫人又补充说，“它是个讨人喜欢的小家伙。

sentences.english: The child's cheek is always red, and especially attractive.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子的脸蛋子总是红扑扑的，格外讨人喜欢。
双鱼座的人基本上都讨人喜欢。

sentences.english: But the way to be lovable is to do lovable things, ” he adds.
sentences.chinese: 但是讨人喜欢的途径是做能够让别人爱你的事情。

sentences.english: I am wonna be a favorite man just for today.
sentences.chinese: 只为今天，我要做个讨人喜欢的人。

sentences.english: I wonder why the kid sweetens these days.
sentences.chinese: 真奇怪，这几天这个小鬼怎么变得这么讨人喜欢了。

sentences.english: He manages to pull off being funny and incredibly endearing at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 他尽量使其扮演的角色风趣同时又非常讨人喜欢。

sentences.english: But flattering interior design choices are near-universal.
sentences.chinese: 但是讨人喜欢的室内设计选择几乎是普遍的。

sentences.english: 'I'll come along with you, then,' Ellen, always agreeable.
sentences.chinese: “那么我来跟你一起，”艾伦总是这么讨人喜欢。

sentences.english: The paparazzo may not be well-liked.
sentences.chinese: 狗仔队也许并不那么讨人喜欢。

sentences.english: The clothes seem to have gotten hipper and more flattering.
sentences.chinese: 衣服似乎更时髦也更讨人喜欢了。

sentences.english: Mystery does not fuel strong relationships and likeability.
sentences.chinese: 神秘感并不能改进人际关系和增强讨人喜欢的程度。

sentences.english: But my character is really cannot ingratiate others.
sentences.chinese: 可是我这样的性格，实在不讨人喜欢。

sentences.english: And the brattish whining is distinctly unattractive.
sentences.chinese: 显然他那些小孩般的抱怨也不讨人喜欢。

definition: loved by all/to have universal appeal
(old) girl trafficked into a brothel to work as prostitute
to act cleverly to get what one desires/to get the best at least expense
to be good at understanding others (idiom)
(of a person's manner or character) gentle and quiet
